question: Question_01_(d)
statement:
\textbf{Short answer questions: Each question carries 6 marks, your
answers should quote the results being used and show your work.}

Suppose that $\displaystyle n = 81294358X$. Write down a digit in the
slot marked \emph{X} so that \emph{n} is divisible by

\begin{itemize}
\itemsep1pt\parskip0pt\parsep0pt
\item
  (a) 11
\item
  (b) 9
\item
  (c) 4
\end{itemize}
sols:
Following the hint, we compute

$\displaystyle 8-1+2-9+4-3+5-8+X = X-2$

and thus if \emph{X} is 2, this sum will be 0 and hence the number will
be divisible by 11. Next, we see that

$\displaystyle 8+1+2+9+4+3+5+8+X = 40 + X$

and thus if \emph{X} is 5, this sum will be divisible by 9 and hence so
will the original number. Lastly, to be divisible by 4, we need the last
two digits to be divisible by 4 so if \emph{X} is one of 0,4, or 8, then
this condition is satisfied and the number will be divisible by 4.
hints:
Recall divisibility rules. For 11, we need the alternating sum of digits
to be divisible by 11 in order for the number to be divisible by 11. For
9, we need the sum of the digits to be divisible by 9. For 4, we need
the last two digits to be divisible by 4.
